title: MS AccessVal()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MS AccessVal()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Read a string and return the numbers found in the string:
SELECT Val(PostalCode) FROM Customers;

Definition and Usage
The Val() function reads a string and returns the numbers found in the string.
Note:
This function stops reading once it 
encounters a NON-numeric character.
Syntax
Val(
string
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
string
Required. A string expression
Technical Details
Works in:
From Access 2000

❯
★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers MS AccessVal()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MS AccessVal()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MS AccessVal()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
